byline.contributor: Yufan Huang and Vanessa Piao contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Chinese authorities announce 23 people have been detained or put under investigation in relation to chemical blasts in Tianjin that left more than 100 people dead; government has been under pressure to provide accounting for explosion, and has called city officials irresponsible for failing to have caught safety violations by Rui Hai International Logistics, owners of warehouse where explosion occurred, earlier.
lead_paragraph: Chinese leaders have moved vigorously in recent days to quell outrage over the blasts, which rattled top leaders and raised questions about the safety of China’s industrial zones.

headline.main: China Holds 23 Linked to Fatal Blasts in Tianjin
headline.print_headline: China Holds Several Linked to Fatal Blasts in Tianjin

snippet: Chinese leaders have moved vigorously in recent days to quell outrage over the blasts, which rattled top leaders and raised questions about the safety of China’s industrial zones.

keywords.value: Rui Hai International Logistics Co Ltd
keywords.name: organizations
